alert.note: Alert for Greenlee (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 21 at 9:06PM MST until August 22 at 9:09PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arizona... Gila River at Duncan affecting Greenlee County. .Heavy rain has led to a rapid rises on the Gila River. This update includes new data on a lower measurement in Virden that is expected to drop the crest at the Gila River in Duncan from moderate to minor flood stage. For the Upper Gila...including Gila River at Duncan...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Gila River at Duncan. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Minor Flood Stage: Highway 70 bridge approach bottom reached on left bank. Dike structure failure is a possibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM MST Sunday the stage was 14.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 20.5 feet late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 900 AM MST.
